alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 10 at 4:00PM MDT until September 10 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Natrona County in central Wyoming... * Until 445 PM MDT. * At 358 PM MDT, a line of severe thunderstorms was located over Homa Hills, which is also 11 miles north of Casper, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. There have been several reports of one inch hail with these storms. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Bar Nunn around 410 PM MDT. Casper around 415 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Mills, Evansville, Paradise Valley and Beartrap Meadows County Park. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 176 and 205. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Very heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
